Package edu.odu.cs.cs350.unitTesting

Class UnitTestMatrix

java.lang.Object
edu.odu.cs.cs350.unitTesting.UnitTestMatrix
public class UnitTestMatrix extends Object
This class tracks Mutator-Accessor coverage for a given class during a unit test execution. It is intended to provide a single instance accumulating a summary report from an arbitrary number of tracked objects of the target class.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static UnitTestMatrix get​(Class<?> classToTrack)
      Obtain a previously registered matrix for a class to be monitored.
      Parameters:
      classToTrack - the class to be watched

    • get

      public static UnitTestMatrix get​(Class<?> classToTrack, List<String> mutatorFunctionNames, List<String> accessorFunctionNames)
      Obtain a class on which coverage is to be monitored.
      Parameters:
      classToTrack - the class to be watched
      mutatorFunctionNames - names of non-constructor, non-static member functions that modify the state of the object
      accessorFunctionNames - names of non-static member functions that examine but do not modify the state of the object

    • numberOfPossiblePairs

      public int numberOfPossiblePairs()
      How many mutator-accessor pairs can be associated with the given class? (This is simply the produce of the number of mutator functions and the number of accessor functions.)
      Returns:
      target value for mutator-accessor coverage

    • numberOfCoveredPairs

      public int numberOfCoveredPairs()
      A mutator-accessor pair (M,A) is covered if the accessor function A is called on an object that was last modified via the mutator function M. This fucntion reports the number of mutator-accessor pairs that have been so covered.

      Invariant: 0 <= numberOfCoveredPairs() <= numberOfPossiblePairs()

      Returns:
      number of covered mutator-accessor pairs.

    • numberOfMutators

      public int numberOfMutators()
      Returns the number of mutators being tracked in the target class, including all constructors and treating overloaded functions as separate instances.
      Returns:
      number of mutators

    • numberOfAccessors

      public int numberOfAccessors()
      Returns the number of accessors being tracked in the target class, treating overloaded functions as separate instances.
      Returns:
      number of mutators

    • covered

      public void covered​(String mutator, int mutatorLineNum, String accessor, int accessorLineNum)
      Mark a mutator-accessor pair as covered.
      Parameters:
      mutator - name of a mutator function in the target class
      mutatorLineNum - line number for disambiguating overloaded functions
      accessor - name of an accessor function in the target class

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Produces a short diagnostic report indicating the total coverage and listing pairs not covered.
